definition: fence/railing/hurdle/column or box (of text or other data)

sentences.english: In this paper, the structure and construction of the flat bottom of short-hole shrinkage stope with grid fence attached are studied.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹了淺孔留礦法平底欄柵底部結構及其施工。

sentences.english: Authorities want a barrier between the animals and everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 有關當局希望將馴鹿和人用欄柵隔離開。

sentences.english: At the right lower corner, barriers intertwined by Marigold - symbol of pacifism is painted.
sentences.chinese: 畫面右下角畫上有代表和平的金盞菊花纏繞著的欄柵。

sentences.english: The two stacks of glass panels were secured to the side railings by fibre ropes.
sentences.chinese: 兩疊玻璃板用纖維繩繫緊在旁邊的欄柵。

sentences.english: The fence marks the boundary between my lands and hers.
sentences.chinese: 這條欄柵是我和她的地的分界線。

sentences.english: Also next to the wood fence Wai an animal laps, a few head of cattle and sheep dependent.
sentences.chinese: 旁邊還用木欄柵圍了一間牲口圈，養有幾頭牛羊。

definition: lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
Iron Curtain (1945-1991) (in Taiwan, 鐵幕 was used to refer to both the Iron Curtain and the Bamboo Curtain)
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
